info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 11:28AM EDT until June 16 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
Wabash River at Montezuma.
.Rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches across portions of central Indiana will produce minor flooding along the Wabash River and Wildcat Creek.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma.
* WHEN...From this evening to late Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Several hundred acres of bottomlands along the right bank from the mouth of Sugar Creek to northern edge of Montezuma begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 14.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 230 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Parke, IN; Vermillion, IN; Vigo, IN
